trans-unit.source: Represents a WS-Federation Sign-In Response message.
This message is created when the action parameter (wa) of the received message is “wsignin1.0” and the message contains a wresult or a wresultptr parameter.

When converting a <xref:System.IdentityModel.Protocols.WSTrust.RequestSecurityTokenResponse> object to a SignInResponseMessage object, the context attribute on the RequestSecurityTokenResponse message is not transferred over, and must be explicitly set.
[!INCLUDE[wif_wsfed_ref](~/add/includes/wif-wsfed-ref-md.md)] For more information about the message that this class represents, see the WS-Federation specification.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.IdentityModel.Services.SignInResponseMessage"></xref> class with the specified base URL and wresult parameter.
The base URL to which the Sign-In Response message applies.
The wresult parameter in the message.
result is or empty.
Initializes an instance of the <xref href="System.IdentityModel.Services.SignInResponseMessage"></xref> class using the specified base URL and wresultptr parameter.
The base URL to which the Sign-In Response message applies.
The wresultptr parameter in the message.
resultPtr is .

Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.IdentityModel.Services.SignInResponseMessage"></xref> class by using the specified base URL, response message object, federation serializer, and serialization context.
The base URL to which the sign-in response message applies.
The <xref href="System.IdentityModel.Protocols.WSTrust.RequestSecurityTokenResponse"></xref> to be returned.
The <xref href="System.IdentityModel.Services.WSFederationSerializer"></xref> to use to serialize the response.
The <xref href="System.IdentityModel.Protocols.WSTrust.WSTrustSerializationContext"></xref> that contains the context for the serialization.
baseUrl is .
-or- Response is .
-or- federationSerializer is .
-or- context is .
Gets or sets the wresult parameter of the message.
Set to `null` or an empty string to remove the wresult parameter from the message.
Either the Result property or the <xref:System.IdentityModel.Services.SignInResponseMessage.ResultPtr%2A> property must be set for the message to be valid.
The value of the wresult parameter.
Gets or sets the wresultptr parameter of the message.
Set to `null` or an empty string to remove the wresultptr parameter from the message.
Either the <xref:System.IdentityModel.Services.SignInResponseMessage.Result%2A> property or the ResultPtr property must be set for the message to be valid.
The value of the wresultptr parameter.
An attempt to set a value that is not a valid, absolute URI occurs.
Can be <xref uid="langword_csharp_null" name="null" href=""></xref> or empty.
Validates the current instance.
Checks that the action parameter (wa) is “wsignin1.0” and that either the wresult parameter or the wresultptr parameter is specified.
The action parameter (wa) is not “wsignin1.0”.
Neither the wresult parameter nor the wresultptr parameter is specified -or- Both the wresult parameter and the wresultptr parameter are specified.
Writes this message in a form post format to the specified text writer.
This method calls the <xref:System.IdentityModel.Services.SignInResponseMessage.Validate%2A> method before writing the message.
The text writer to which to write the message.
writer is .
